data.title: Check out the Italian Hometown of Frank Sinatra
data.meta_description: Did you know that he has roots in the Palermo town of Lercara Friddi? Watch the exclusive video to learn more about Frank Sinatra's Italian hometown
data.text:
Born Francis Albert Sinatra on December 12th 1915 to Italian immigrant parents in Hoboken, New Jersey, Frank Sinatra began his musical journey listening to the likes of Bing Crosby. He began singing professionally in his teenager, learning music by ear. He got his first big break when he joined a trio in 1935. In 1946 he broke onto the music scene with his debut album, "The Voice of Frank Sinatra."

Did you know that he has roots in the Palermo town of Lercara Friddi? Watch the exclusive video to learn more about Frank Sinatra's Italian hometown.
